item.title: Preliminary Results on Saturated Chase-Like Trees
item.description: General Definitions surrounding $\SatTree$s Definition. For chase-like tree $T$ and its vertex $v \in T_0$, we say that $v$ mentions a factual term $t$ if $\Instance_T(v)$ contains a fact $P(\vec{t’})$ such that $t \in \elems(\vec{t’})$.

item.title: Saturations
item.description: This note builds on [[Rewritings]] Given an instance $I$ and a finite set $\Sigma$ of Datalog rules, we can form the smallest superinstance of $I$ satisfying $\Sigma$, which we shall call $\Sat_\Sigma(I)$.
